    Resources & materials

    Oxford University resources

    Research Data Oxford: contains the official Oxford University policy regarding research data management, and has helpful information about research data policy.

    Open Access Oxford has useful resources on open access publishing.

    R user group Oxford hosts events for all users of R.

    Codebar Oxford offers free programming workshops, with the goal to make the tech community more diverse!

    ReproducibiliTea podcasts: these cover topics like questionable research practices, the preregistration evolution, and the natural selection of bad science. Run by the same team behind the ReproducibiliTea journal clubs.

    Other resources

    The NeuroAnaTody blog page by Ana Todorovic has lots of useful blog posts on reproducibility and open research, including summaries of many talks that were given as part of the Oxford Reproducibility lectures.

    Redditâ€™s meta-research thread has a great list of recommended articles related to meta-research.

    Course syllabi for open and reproducibility methods are listed on this OSF page.

    Software Carpentry and Data Carpentry teach computational methods to improve reproducibility. You can attend some of these carpentry events through Reproducible Research Oxford.
